name: Montana Rescue Mission Women's and Children's Shelter
organization: Montana Rescue Mission Women's and Children's Shelter
description:
The Montana Rescue Mission Women's and Children's Shelter, located at 2520 Minnesota Ave, serves single women, and women with children.  We also provide assistance to intact families. Three nutritious meals a day are served in our dining room for shelter guests only.  Upon check-in, guests receive essential hygiene products and emergency clothing.  A public shower facility is available, to Women and Children only, Monday thru Friday 9:00am -11:00am and 2:00pm-4:00pm.  All services are free of charge.

In addition to Emergency Shelter, we offer our guests a wide variety of programs to help make their stay with us productive by providing vital tools to overcome the causes of their homelessness. We offer classes in parenting, life skills, anger management, proper nutrition and food preparation, conflict resolution, addiction counseling, and spiritual development.  In addition, there are educational opportunities to improve skills and a dedicated computer lab that can be used for resume preparation, job searches and GED preparation. Chapel services are offered on a regular basis and staff are available for one-on-one counseling.

We are available 24 hours a day.

name: Montana Rescue Mission for Men
description:
The Montana Rescue Mission Men's Shelter, located at 2822 Minnesota Avenue, serves single men and provides assistance to single men with children and intact families. Shelter Guests receive three nutritious meals a day and the community dining room is open to the public for lunch and dinner.  Upon check-in, guests receive essential hygiene products and emergency clothing.  A public shower facility is available, to Men only, Monday thru Friday 9:00am -11:00am and 2:00pm-4:00pm. All services are free of charge.
In addition to Emergency Shelter, we offer our guests a wide variety of programs to help make their stay with us productive by providing vital tools to overcome the causes of their homelessness. We offer classes in parenting, life skills, anger management, proper nutrition, conflict resolution, addiction counseling,  and spiritual development. Chapel services are offered on a regular basis and staff are available for one-on-one counseling. In addition, there are educational opportunities to improve skills and a dedicated computer lab that can be used for resume preparation, job searches and GED preparation.

Riverstone Health Care also provides Healthcare for the Homeless in the Mens Shelter Monday and Wednesday 7am - 10am, Friday 7am - 11am. Women and Children are also able to access this program.

We are available 24 hours a day.

name: New Family New Life Women's And Children's Shelter
organization: New Family New Life Women's And Children's Shelter
description: This is for women and children only. This is either a transitional community or emergency shelter.10 bedrooms are available with wood fireplaces.All inquiries are asked some simple questions before admittance. Like photos and goals.

name: Battered Woman's Shelter
description: shelter for women who are victims of domestic violence

name: Family Promise of Gallatin Valley
description: day shelter for families with children

name: Warming Center
description: Warming Center sponsored by THE GREATER GALLATIN HOMLESS ACTION COALITION. SPONSORED BY THE NON-PROFIT HRDC AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS, THE WARMING CENTER OFFERS ANY PERSON OR FAMILY A SAFE, WARM PLACE TO SLEEP. THIS VITAL WINTER SERVICE IS AVAILABLE FROM THANKSGIVING THROUGH MARCH on the corner of Industrial Ave and East Griffin Dr, about 1/4 mile East of the train tracks, FROM 7 PM TO 7 AM, 7 DAYS A WEEK.

name: Butte Rescue Mission
description: We provide temporary housing for those in need. We serve 3 meals a day,and provide showers, laundry,also. The shelter is on a 1.6-acre Center of Hope campus in Buttes warehouse district near a bus route. Meals provided. Thrift Store is still at 123 E. Park St.

name: The Friendship Center
description: Women and children shelter for victims of domestic violence

name: Samaritan House
description:
Samaritan House is a homeless shelter and transitional living program in Kalispell, Montana. The mission of the Samaritan House is to provide shelter and basic needs for homeless people, while fostering self-respect and human dignity.

Housing: Samaritan House provides food, housing, resources, and case management for the homeless in Kalispell and beyond the Flathead Valley. We served 34,860 meals, 1,350 people, including nearly 200 families and 225 Veterans.


Our Veteran's Program is dedicated to assisting homeless United States veterans by providing resources allowing them access to physical and mental health check ups. Along with these services, we also provide affordable housing.

name: A Ray of Hope
description: We provide the greater flathead valley; we get calls from other communities to help their homeless and from the courts to take people suffering with addiction who cannot afford in house. In cold weather we get calls to get people off the streets. We have police show up with people who would freeze and the Jails are full. We then make beds on the floor, and provide hot meals, tents and sleeping bags. As we take now state or federal funding we have greater latitude to have them slept on our floors and porch. We get many requests a day for help people to stay in their homes and this time we can only help one out of five requests. Many in our valley and around the state of Montana have lost jobs and are losing their homes. There are times the only way we can help them is to help them go to family in another state to care for them.

name: Union Gospel Mission of Missoula (formely Missoula 3:16)
organization: Union Gospel Mission of Missoula (formely Missoula 3:16)
description: At our downtown location, Union Gospel Mission of Missoula provides hot meals, daytime shelter, a food pantry, use of phone and mail service, mentorship, and networking for appropriate community services. We also have a Thrift Boutique and will soon be opening a Women & Children's Shelter in the quiet of our country-side location. All our services are offered for any who choose them, are geared toward healthy life choices, and are provided with the love of Christ Jesus.

name: Poverello Center - The Poverello Center
description: 30 days of emergency shelter for both men and women. Shelter for all men and women, 3 meals a day provided.
